New Records: Robbie Brady scored a late goal to give Ireland a first ever away win in the Nations League
Key Match Events: Robbie Brady scored the winning goal in the 88th minute
Finland came close to taking the lead in the 88th minute but couldn't score
Nathan Collins made an error that led to Finland's goal in the 16th minute
Evan Ferguson's goal was ruled out due to a yellow flag in the 21st minute
Pre-Game Insights: Heimir Hallgrimsson's reign as Ireland manager is up and running after the win
Ireland were struggling to find a victory from somewhere
The team needed a turning point, and Robbie Brady delivered
Post-Match Reflections: The win was a much-needed boost for the team and their fans
Heimir Hallgrimsson praised Robbie Brady for his late goal and commitment to the cause
The team's captain, Nathan Collins, had a night to forget after making an error that led to Finland's goal
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a close and intense affair, with both teams creating chances
The yellow flag has been a problem for Ireland in their last two games
Aaron Connolly, a previously discarded player, has been working to get his life in order and may be due for an international recall
